chapter.p: 1Then Yahweh said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me,Literally “to the face of me” my heart would not be to this people. Send them away from my sight,Literally “face” and let them go out. 2And thenLiterally “And it will happen” if they say to you, ‘Where shall we go?’ Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says Yahweh,

ul.li1: “Those who are destined for the plague, to the plague,
and those who are destined for the sword, to the sword,
and those who are destined for the famine, to the famine,
and those who are destined for the captivity, to the captivity.” ’

chapter.p: 3“And I will summonOr “appoint” over them four types of calamity,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh, “the sword to kill, and the dogs to drag away, and the birdsHebrew “bird” of the air and the wild animalsHebrew “wild animal” of the earth to devour and to destroy. 4And I will make them a terror to all of the kingdoms of the earth because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, the king of Judah, because of what he did in Jerusalem.

ul.li1: 5“For who will have compassion on you, O Jerusalem,
ul.li2: or who will show sympathy to you,
or who will turn aside to ask about your welfare?Literally “to ask to the welfare of you”
ul.li1: 6You have forsaken me,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li2: “You go backward, so I have stretched my hand against you,
ul.li1: and I have destroyed you.
ul.li2: I am tired of becoming remorseful.
ul.li1: 7And I have winnowed them with a winnowing fork in the gates of the land.
ul.li2: I am bereaved.
ul.li1: I have destroyed my people.
ul.li2: They did not turn back from their ways.
ul.li1: 8Their widowsHebrew “widow” will be more numerous before me than the sand of the seas.
ul.li2: I have brought to them, against the mothersHebrew “mother” of young men,Hebrew “man”
ul.li1: a destroyer at noon.
ul.li2: I will suddenly drop on her anguish and horror.Hebrew “horrors”
ul.li1: 9She who gave birth to seven has withered away.
ul.li2: She gasps her breath.
ul.li1: Her sun setLiterally “came” while still day.
ul.li2: She has been put to shame and disgraced.
ul.li1: And the remainder of them I will give to the sword
ul.li2: beforeLiterally “to the face of” their enemies,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.

ul.li1: 10Woe to me, O my mother, that you gave birth to me,
ul.li2: a man of contention and quarreling to the whole land.Literally “to all of the land”
ul.li1: I have not lent out and I have not borrowed.Literally “not they have lent out for me”
ul.li2: All of them are cursing me.

ul.li1: “SurelyLiterally “If not” I will set you free to be goodLiterally “for good” for you,
ul.li2: surelyLiterally “if not” I will cause the enemy to intercede with you
ul.li1: in a time of trouble,
ul.li2: and in a time of distress.
ul.li1: 12Can anyone break iron,
ul.li2: iron from the north, or bronze?
ul.li1: 13I will give your wealth and your treasures
ul.li2: as plunder without price,
ul.li1: even because of all your sins,
ul.li2: and throughout all your territories.
ul.li1: 14And I will make you serve your enemies
ul.li2: in a land that you do not know,
ul.li1: for a fire will kindle in my anger.
ul.li2: Upon you it will be kindled.”
ul.li1: 15You who know, O Yahweh, remember me, and attend to me,
ul.li2: and take revenge for me against my persecutors in your forbearance.Literally “in the length of your nose”
ul.li1: You must take me away.
ul.li2: Know that I am carrying disgrace because of you.
ul.li1: 16Your words were found and I ate them,
ul.li2: and your words became to me as jubilation,
ul.li1: even as the joy of my heart,
ul.li2: for your name is called on me, O Yahweh God of hosts.
ul.li1: 17I sat not in the assembly of jokers,
ul.li2: nor did I exult.
ul.li1: Because of the presenceLiterally “face” of your hand I sat alone,
ul.li2: for you filled me with indignation.
ul.li1: 18Why is my pain endless, and my wound incurable?
ul.li2: It refuses to become healed.
ul.li1: Truly you are to me like a deceitful brook,
ul.li2: waters that are not trustworthy.

ul.li1: “If you turn back, then I will take you back.
ul.li2: You will stand before me.Literally “to the face of me”
ul.li1: And if you utter what is precious and not what is worthless,
ul.li2: you will be as my mouth.
ul.li1: They will turn back to you,
ul.li2: and you will not turn back to them.
ul.li1: 20And I will make you to this people
ul.li2: a wall of fortified bronze,
ul.li1: and they will fight against you,
ul.li2: but they will not prevail over you,
ul.li1: for I am with you, to save you,
ul.li2: and to deliver you,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 21“And I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked,
ul.li2: and I will redeem you from the hand of the tyrant.”
